p: Calcium alanate has a total hydrogen content of 7.9 wt.%. Its complete decomposition occurs in four steps; the first two steps liberate 5.2–5.9 wt.% hydrogen of the theoretical 7.15 wt.% [ 165, 219, 220]. The dehydrogenation reactions are [ 220]: Ca(AlH 4) 2 → CaAlH 5 + Al + 3/2H 2 (100–160° C) (45)
